pullRequest.body:
Add a theorem on the equality condition of the weighted AM-GM inequality for real-valued nonnegative functions, referring to `geom_mean_arith_mean_weighted_eq_iff` in `Mathlib/Analysis/MeanInequalities.lean`.


---
<!-- 

The discussion in zulip is here: https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Adding.20Equality.20Conditions.20to.20MeanInequalities.20in.20Mathlib4.

It's my first time to make a pr in mathlib4. I plan to incrementally add equality conditions of the cases in `MeanInequalities.lean` to the original file and commit. Once it grows large enough, I'll organize them into a separate file.

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [8a14d1479e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19435/commits/8a14d1479e205ffa4f8c47cb8acf10cb81dedf4a)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ geom_mean_arith_mean_weighted_eq_iff`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
The usual way to prove the equality case of an inequality is to first prove its strict inequality case. Could you please do that here? Thanks!

Can you adapt the proof to show this?
```suggestion
theorem geom_mean_arith_mean_weighted_eq_iff (w z : Œπ ‚Üí ‚Ñù) (hw : ‚àÄ i ‚àà s, 0 ‚â§ w i)
    (hw' : ‚àë i ‚àà s, w i = 1) (hz : ‚àÄ i ‚àà s, 0 ‚â§ z i) :
    ‚àè i ‚àà s, z i ^ w i = ‚àë i ‚àà s, w i * z i ‚Üî ‚àÄ j ‚àà s, 0 < w j ‚Üí z j = ‚àë i ‚àà s, w i * z i := by
```
Sure, I‚Äôd be happy to do that.

I noticed that in a similar lemma `strictConvexOn_exp.map_sum_eq_iff'`, it uses `w j ‚â† 0 ‚Üí` rather than `0 < w j ‚Üí`. Is it better to use `‚â†` or `<` here?

```
lemma StrictConvexOn.map_sum_eq_iff' (hf : StrictConvexOn ùïú s f) (h‚ÇÄ : ‚àÄ i ‚àà t, 0 ‚â§ w i)
    (h‚ÇÅ : ‚àë i ‚àà t, w i = 1) (hmem : ‚àÄ i ‚àà t, p i ‚àà s) :
    f (‚àë i ‚àà t, w i ‚Ä¢ p i) = ‚àë i ‚àà t, w i ‚Ä¢ f (p i) ‚Üî
      ‚àÄ j ‚àà t, w j ‚â† 0 ‚Üí p j = ‚àë i ‚àà t, w i ‚Ä¢ p i
```

I wrote two more version based on the first version, `geom_mean_arith_mean_weighted_eq_iff'` and `geom_mean_arith_mean_weighted_eq_iff''`.
But the linter said something like "missing a doc-string".
I'm not sure how to properly document this -- any guidance? Thanks.

```
theorem geom_mean_arith_mean_weighted_eq_iff' (w z : Œπ ‚Üí ‚Ñù) (hw : ‚àÄ i ‚àà s, 0 ‚â§ w i)
    (hw' : ‚àë i ‚àà s, w i = 1) (hz : ‚àÄ i ‚àà s, 0 ‚â§ z i) :
    ‚àè i ‚àà s, z i ^ w i = ‚àë i ‚àà s, w i * z i ‚Üî ‚àÄ j ‚àà s, w j ‚â† 0 ‚Üí z j = ‚àë i ‚àà s, w i * z i := by
  have h (i) (_ : i ‚àà s) : w i * z i ‚â† 0 ‚Üí w i ‚â† 0 := by aesop
  have h' (i) (_ : i ‚àà s) : z i ^ w i ‚â† 1 ‚Üí w i ‚â† 0 := by aesop
  rw [‚Üê sum_filter_of_ne h, ‚Üê prod_filter_of_ne h', geom_mean_arith_mean_weighted_eq_iff]
  ¬∑ simp
  ¬∑ simp (config := { contextual := true }) [(hw _ _).gt_iff_ne]
  ¬∑ rwa [sum_filter_ne_zero]
  ¬∑ simp_all only [ne_eq, mul_eq_zero, not_or, not_false_eq_true, and_imp, implies_true, mem_filter]

theorem geom_mean_arith_mean_weighted_eq_iff'' (w z : Œπ ‚Üí ‚Ñù) (hw : ‚àÄ i ‚àà s, 0 ‚â§ w i)
    (hw' : ‚àë i ‚àà s, w i = 1) (hz : ‚àÄ i ‚àà s, 0 ‚â§ z i) :
    ‚àè i ‚àà s, z i ^ w i = ‚àë i ‚àà s, w i * z i ‚Üî ‚àÄ j ‚àà s, 0 < w j ‚Üí z j = ‚àë i ‚àà s, w i * z i := by
  have h (i) (a : i ‚àà s) : w i * z i ‚â† 0 ‚Üí 0 < w i := fun _ => lt_of_le_of_ne' (hw i a) (by aesop)
  have h' (i) (a : i ‚àà s) : z i ^ w i ‚â† 1 ‚Üí 0 < w i := fun _ => lt_of_le_of_ne' (hw i a) (by aesop)
  rw [‚Üê sum_filter_of_ne h, ‚Üê prod_filter_of_ne h', geom_mean_arith_mean_weighted_eq_iff]
  ¬∑ simp
  ¬∑ simp (config := { contextual := true }) [(hw _ _).gt_iff_ne]
  ¬∑ have : filter (fun x => 0 < w x) s = filter (fun x => w x ‚â† 0) s := by
      apply filter_congr
      exact fun x hx => ‚ü®fun a => (ne_of_lt a).symm, fun a => lt_of_le_of_ne (hw x hx) a.symm‚ü©
    rwa [this, sum_filter_ne_zero]
  ¬∑ simp_all only [ne_eq, mul_eq_zero, not_or, not_false_eq_true, and_imp, implies_true, mem_filter]
```

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/56d679f4-6656-463d-8f86-3ff0abed4f25)
`‚â†` is better, sorry for the misguidance. I think here the best move is to completely remove your first lemma in favor of your second lemma

pullRequest.title: feat: an equality condition for AM-GM inequality
